what: Download and Import the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) Data Set into R
title: Download and Import the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) Data Set into R
text: HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) committee Human Genome Organisation (HUGO) sets standards human gene nomenclature. HGNC approves unique meaningful name every known human gene, based group experts. addition, HGNC also provides mapping gene symbols gene entries popular databases resources: HGNC complete gene set. goal hgnc easily download import latest HGNC complete gene data set R. data set provides useful mapping HGNC symbols gene entries popular databases resources, , Entrez gene identifier UCSC gene identifier, among many others. Check documentation function import_hgnc_dataset() description several fields available.

title: Download and Import the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) Data Set into R
text: Install hgnc CRAN: can install development version hgnc like :

title: Download and Import the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) Data Set into R
text: import latest HGNC gene data set tabular format directly memory tibble follows: original data set contain column hgnc_id2, added convenience hgnc; although HGNC identifiers formally contain prefix "HGNC:", often found elsewhere stripped prefix, column hgnc_id2 also provided whose values contain integer part.
code: library(hgnc)  # Date of HGNC last update last_update() #> [1] "2023-08-31 02:04:51 UTC"  # Set the HGNC archive file to use for the remainder of the R-session use_hgnc_file(file = latest_archive_url()) #> using hgnc file: https://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/genenames/hgnc/tsv/hgnc_complete_set.txt  # Import the data set in tidy tabular format # NB: Multiple-value columns are kept as list-columns hgnc_dataset <- import_hgnc_dataset()  dplyr::glimpse(hgnc_dataset) #> Rows: 43,718 #> Columns: 55 #> $ hgnc_id                  <chr> "HGNC:5", "HGNC:37133", "HGNC:24086", "HGNC:7… #> $ hgnc_id2                 <int> 5, 37133, 24086, 7, 27057, 23336, 41022, 4152… #> $ symbol                   <chr> "A1BG", "A1BG-AS1", "A1CF", "A2M", "A2M-AS1",… #> $ name                     <chr> "alpha-1-B glycoprotein", "A1BG antisense RNA… #> $ locus_group              <chr> "protein-coding gene", "non-coding RNA", "pro… #> $ locus_type               <chr> "gene with protein product", "RNA, long non-c… #> $ status                   <chr> "Approved", "Approved", "Approved", "Approved… #> $ location                 <chr> "19q13.43", "19q13.43", "10q11.23", "12p13.31… #> $ location_sortable        <chr> "19q13.43", "19q13.43", "10q11.23", "12p13.31… #> $ alias_symbol             <list> NA, "FLJ23569", <"ACF", "ASP", "ACF64", "ACF… #> $ alias_name               <list> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, <"iGb3 s… #> $ prev_symbol              <list> NA, <"NCRNA00181", "A1BGAS", "A1BG-AS">, NA,… #> $ prev_name                <list> NA, <"non-protein coding RNA 181", "A1BG ant… #> $ gene_group               <list> "Immunoglobulin like domain containing", "An… #> $ gene_group_id            <list> "594", "1987", "725", "2148", "1987", "2148"… #> $ date_approved_reserved   <date> 1989-06-30, 2009-07-20, 2007-11-23, 1986-01-… #> $ date_symbol_changed      <date> NA, 2010-11-25, NA, NA, NA, 2005-09-01, NA, … #> $ date_name_changed        <date> NA, 2012-08-15, NA, NA, 2018-03-21, 2016-03-… #> $ date_modified            <date> 2023-01-20, 2013-06-27, 2023-01-20, 2023-01-… #> $ entrez_id                <int> 1, 503538, 29974, 2, 144571, 144568, 10087410… #> $ ensembl_gene_id          <chr> "ENSG00000121410", "ENSG00000268895", "ENSG00… #> $ vega_id                  <chr> "OTTHUMG00000183507", "OTTHUMG00000183508", "… #> $ ucsc_id                  <chr> "uc002qsd.5", "uc002qse.3", "uc057tgv.1", "uc… #> $ ena                      <list> NA, "BC040926", "AF271790", <"BX647329", "X6… #> $ refseq_accession         <list> "NM_130786", "NR_015380", "NM_014576", "NM_0… #> $ ccds_id                  <list> "CCDS12976", NA, <"CCDS7242", "CCDS73133", "… #> $ uniprot_ids              <list> "P04217", NA, "Q9NQ94", "P01023", NA, "A8K2U… #> $ pubmed_id                <list> "2591067", NA, <"11815617", "11072063">, <"2… #> $ mgd_id                   <list> "MGI:2152878", NA, "MGI:1917115", "MGI:24491… #> $ rgd_id                   <list> "RGD:69417", NA, "RGD:619834", "RGD:2004", N… #> $ lsdb                     <chr> NA, NA, NA, "LRG_591|http://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub… #> $ cosmic                   <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N… #> $ omim_id                  <list> "138670", NA, "618199", "103950", NA, "61062… #> $ mirbase                  <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N… #> $ homeodb                  <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N… #> $ snornabase               <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N… #> $ bioparadigms_slc         <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N… #> $ orphanet                 <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, "410627", NA, NA, NA, NA,… #> $ pseudogene.org           <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, "PGOHUM000002… #> $ horde_id                 <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N… #> $ merops                   <chr> "I43.950", NA, NA, "I39.001", NA, "I39.007", … #> $ imgt                     <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N… #> $ iuphar                   <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N… #> $ kznf_gene_catalog        <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N… #> $ `mamit-trnadb`           <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N… #> $ cd                       <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N… #> $ lncrnadb                 <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N… #> $ enzyme_id                <list> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, "2.4… #> $ intermediate_filament_db <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N… #> $ rna_central_ids          <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N… #> $ lncipedia                <chr> NA, "A1BG-AS1", NA, NA, "A2M-AS1", NA, "A2ML1… #> $ gtrnadb                  <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N… #> $ agr                      <chr> "HGNC:5", "HGNC:37133", "HGNC:24086", "HGNC:7… #> $ mane_select              <list> <"ENST00000263100.8", "NM_130786.4">, NA, <"… #> $ gencc                    <chr> NA, NA, NA, "HGNC:7", NA, "HGNC:23336", NA, N… hgnc_dataset %>%   dplyr::select(c('hgnc_id', 'hgnc_id2')) #> # A tibble: 43,718 × 2 #>    hgnc_id    hgnc_id2 #>    <chr>         <int> #>  1 HGNC:5            5 #>  2 HGNC:37133    37133 #>  3 HGNC:24086    24086 #>  4 HGNC:7            7 #>  5 HGNC:27057    27057 #>  6 HGNC:23336    23336 #>  7 HGNC:41022    41022 #>  8 HGNC:41523    41523 #>  9 HGNC:8            8 #> 10 HGNC:30005    30005 #> # … with 43,708 more rows

title: Download and Import the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) Data Set into R
text: HGNC defines group name (locus_group) set related locus types. ’s can quickly check many gene entries per locus group. locus_type provides finer classification:
code: hgnc_dataset %>%   dplyr::count(locus_group, sort = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   locus_group             n #>   <chr>               <int> #> 1 protein-coding gene 19278 #> 2 pseudogene          14362 #> 3 non-coding RNA       9087 #> 4 other                 991 hgnc_dataset %>%   dplyr::group_by(locus_group) %>%   dplyr::count(locus_type, sort = TRUE) %>%   dplyr::arrange(locus_group) %>%   print(n = Inf) #> # A tibble: 23 × 3 #> # Groups:   locus_group [4] #>    locus_group         locus_type                     n #>    <chr>               <chr>                      <int> #>  1 non-coding RNA      RNA, long non-coding        5750 #>  2 non-coding RNA      RNA, micro                  1912 #>  3 non-coding RNA      RNA, transfer                591 #>  4 non-coding RNA      RNA, small nucleolar         568 #>  5 non-coding RNA      RNA, cluster                 119 #>  6 non-coding RNA      RNA, ribosomal                60 #>  7 non-coding RNA      RNA, small nuclear            50 #>  8 non-coding RNA      RNA, misc                     29 #>  9 non-coding RNA      RNA, vault                     4 #> 10 non-coding RNA      RNA, Y                         4 #> 11 other               immunoglobulin gene          230 #> 12 other               T cell receptor gene         206 #> 13 other               readthrough                  147 #> 14 other               fragile site                 116 #> 15 other               endogenous retrovirus        109 #> 16 other               complex locus constituent     69 #> 17 other               unknown                       68 #> 18 other               region                        38 #> 19 other               virus integration site         8 #> 20 protein-coding gene gene with protein product  19278 #> 21 pseudogene          pseudogene                 14122 #> 22 pseudogene          immunoglobulin pseudogene    203 #> 23 pseudogene          T cell receptor pseudogene    37

title: Download and Import the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) Data Set into R
text: default hgnc use latest version HGNC archive dataset, returned function latest_archive_url(). Besides latest archive, HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) website also provides monthly quarterly updates. can conveniently get latest monthly quarterly updates running latest_monthly_url() latest_quarterly_url(). Use list_archives() list currently available download archives. column url contains direct download link can pass use_hgnc_file() import_hgnc_dataset() import data R.
code: list_archives() #> # A tibble: 107 × 7 #>    series  dataset           file     date       size  last_modified       url   #>    <chr>   <chr>             <chr>    <date>     <chr> <dttm>              <chr> #>  1 monthly hgnc_complete_set hgnc_co… 2021-03-01 14M   2023-05-01 00:05:00 http… #>  2 monthly hgnc_complete_set hgnc_co… 2021-04-01 15M   2023-05-01 00:05:00 http… #>  3 monthly hgnc_complete_set hgnc_co… 2021-05-01 15M   2023-05-01 00:05:00 http… #>  4 monthly hgnc_complete_set hgnc_co… 2021-06-01 15M   2023-05-01 00:05:00 http… #>  5 monthly hgnc_complete_set hgnc_co… 2021-07-01 15M   2023-05-01 00:05:00 http… #>  6 monthly hgnc_complete_set hgnc_co… 2021-08-01 15M   2023-05-01 00:05:00 http… #>  7 monthly hgnc_complete_set hgnc_co… 2021-09-01 15M   2023-05-01 00:05:00 http… #>  8 monthly hgnc_complete_set hgnc_co… 2021-10-01 15M   2023-05-01 00:05:00 http… #>  9 monthly hgnc_complete_set hgnc_co… 2021-11-01 15M   2023-05-01 00:05:00 http… #> 10 monthly hgnc_complete_set hgnc_co… 2021-12-01 15M   2023-05-01 00:05:00 http… #> # … with 97 more rows  use_hgnc_file(file = latest_monthly_url()) #> using hgnc file: https://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/genenames/hgnc/archive/monthly/tsv/hgnc_complete_set_2023-08-01.txt

title: Download and Import the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) Data Set into R
text: prefer download data set file disk first, can use download_archive(). , can use import_hgnc_dataset() import downloaded file R.

title: Download and Import the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) Data Set into R
text: Two convenience functions provided convert different gene identifiers HGNC dataset: hgnc_join takes input data frame adds additional column HGNC dataset, hgnc_convert converts vector one identifier another.
code: dplyr::tibble(hgnc_id = c("HGNC:44948", "HGNC:43240", "HGNC:23357", "HGNC:1855", "HGNC:39400")) %>%    # add in gene symbol   hgnc_join(by = 'hgnc_id', column = 'symbol') %>%    # add in entrez_id   hgnc_join(by = 'hgnc_id', column = 'entrez_id') #> # A tibble: 5 × 3 #>   hgnc_id    symbol    entrez_id #>   <chr>      <chr>         <int> #> 1 HGNC:44948 GOLGA2P6     729668 #> 2 HGNC:43240 RNA5SP340 100873603 #> 3 HGNC:23357 MCTS1         28985 #> 4 HGNC:1855  CENPCP1        1061 #> 5 HGNC:39400 ASNSP4    100419423  # convert a set of hgnc_ids to symbols hgnc_ids <- c("HGNC:44948", "HGNC:43240", "HGNC:23357", "HGNC:1855", "HGNC:39400") hgnc_convert(hgnc_ids, from = 'hgnc_id', to = 'symbol') #> [1] "GOLGA2P6"  "RNA5SP340" "MCTS1"     "CENPCP1"   "ASNSP4"  # convert a set of entrez_ids to ensembl_gene_ids entrez_ids <- c(79933, 109623458, 158471, 54987, 81631) hgnc_convert(entrez_ids, from = 'entrez_id', to = 'ensembl_gene_id') #> [1] "ENSG00000166317" NA                "ENSG00000106772" "ENSG00000162384" #> [5] "ENSG00000140941"

title: Download and Import the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) Data Set into R
text: default hgnc use memory-based caching package memoise. ensure time consuming downloads rerun unnecessarily single R-session. Persistent disk based caching can also enabled using function use_cache_dir.

title: Download and Import the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) Data Set into R
text: go www.genenames.org download files . need R package? hgnc really just convenience package. main advantage function import_hgnc_dataset() reads data tabular format columns appropriate type (don’t specify ). extra step, variables contain multiple values encoded list-columns. Remember list-columns can expanded tidyr::unnest(). E.g., alias_symbol list-column containing multiple alternative aliases standard symbol: addition, also provide function filter_by_keyword() allows filtering data set based keyword regular expression. default function look columns contain gene symbols names (symbol, name, alias_symbol, alias_name, prev_symbol prev_name). works automatically list-columns . Look entries data set contain keyword "TP53": Restrict search symbol column: Search whole word "TP53" exactly taking advantage regular expressions:
code: hgnc_dataset %>%   dplyr::filter(symbol == 'TP53') %>%   dplyr::select(c('symbol', 'alias_symbol')) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   symbol alias_symbol #>   <chr>  <list>       #> 1 TP53   <chr [2]>  hgnc_dataset %>%   dplyr::filter(symbol == 'TP53') %>%   dplyr::select(c('symbol', 'alias_symbol')) %>%   tidyr::unnest(cols = 'alias_symbol') #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   symbol alias_symbol #>   <chr>  <chr>        #> 1 TP53   p53          #> 2 TP53   LFS1 hgnc_dataset %>%   filter_by_keyword('TP53') %>%   dplyr::select(1:4) #> # A tibble: 66 × 4 #>    hgnc_id    hgnc_id2 symbol      name                                          #>    <chr>         <int> <chr>       <chr>                                         #>  1 HGNC:49685    49685 ABHD15-AS1  ABHD15 antisense RNA 1                        #>  2 HGNC:20679    20679 ANO9        anoctamin 9                                   #>  3 HGNC:40093    40093 BCAR3-AS1   BCAR3 antisense RNA 1                         #>  4 HGNC:13276    13276 EI24        EI24 autophagy associated transmembrane prot… #>  5 HGNC:3345      3345 ENC1        ectodermal-neural cortex 1                    #>  6 HGNC:27919    27919 ERVMER61-1  endogenous retrovirus group MER61 member 1    #>  7 HGNC:56226    56226 FAM169A-AS1 FAM169A antisense RNA 1                       #>  8 HGNC:4136      4136 GAMT        guanidinoacetate N-methyltransferase          #>  9 HGNC:54868    54868 KLRK1-AS1   KLRK1 antisense RNA 1                         #> 10 HGNC:6568      6568 LGALS7      galectin 7                                    #> # … with 56 more rows hgnc_dataset %>%   filter_by_keyword('TP53', cols = 'symbol') %>%   dplyr::select(1:4) #> # A tibble: 23 × 4 #>    hgnc_id    hgnc_id2 symbol    name                                            #>    <chr>         <int> <chr>     <chr>                                           #>  1 HGNC:11998    11998 TP53      tumor protein p53                               #>  2 HGNC:29984    29984 TP53AIP1  tumor protein p53 regulated apoptosis inducing… #>  3 HGNC:11999    11999 TP53BP1   tumor protein p53 binding protein 1             #>  4 HGNC:12000    12000 TP53BP2   tumor protein p53 binding protein 2             #>  5 HGNC:16328    16328 TP53BP2P1 tumor protein p53 binding protein 2 pseudogene… #>  6 HGNC:43652    43652 TP53COR1  tumor protein p53 pathway corepressor 1         #>  7 HGNC:19373    19373 TP53I3    tumor protein p53 inducible protein 3           #>  8 HGNC:16842    16842 TP53I11   tumor protein p53 inducible protein 11          #>  9 HGNC:25102    25102 TP53I13   tumor protein p53 inducible protein 13          #> 10 HGNC:18022    18022 TP53INP1  tumor protein p53 inducible nuclear protein 1   #> # … with 13 more rows hgnc_dataset %>%   filter_by_keyword('^TP53$', cols = 'symbol') %>%   dplyr::select(1:4) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   hgnc_id    hgnc_id2 symbol name              #>   <chr>         <int> <chr>  <chr>             #> 1 HGNC:11998    11998 TP53   tumor protein p53

title: Download and Import the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) Data Set into R
text: cite HGNC nomenclature resources use: Tweedie S, Braschi B, Gray KA, Jones TEM, Seal RL, Yates B, Bruford EA. Genenames.org: HGNC VGNC resources 2021. Nucleic Acids Res. 49, D939–D946 (2021). doi: 10.1093/nar/gkaa980 cite data within database use following format: HGNC Database, HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC), European Molecular Biology Laboratory, European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI), Wellcome Genome Campus, Hinxton, Cambridge CB10 1SD, United Kingdom www.genenames.org. Please include month year retrieved data cited.

title: Download HGNC dataset — download_archive
text: Download latest HGNC approved data set.

title: Download HGNC dataset — download_archive
code: download_archive(   url = get_hgnc_file(),   path = getwd(),   filename = basename(url),   ... )

title: Download HGNC dataset — download_archive
text: url character string naming URL HGNC dataset. defaults latest available archive. path character string directory path downloaded file saved. default, current working directory. filename character string name saved file. default, inferred last part URL. ... Additional arguments passed download.file().

title: Filter genes by keyword — filter_by_keyword
text: Filter HGNC data set keyword looked columns containing gene names symbols. default, look symbol, name, alias_symbol, alias_name, prev_symbol prev_name. Note function dive list-columns match return hit result least one strings matches keyword.

title: Filter genes by keyword — filter_by_keyword
Filter genes by keyword — filter_by_keyword
text: tbl tibble containing HGNC data set, typically obtained import_hgnc_dataset(). keyword keyword regular expression used search criterion. cols Columns looked .

title: Filter genes by keyword — filter_by_keyword
text: tibble HGNC data set filtered observations matching keyword.

title: Filter genes by keyword — filter_by_keyword
code: if (FALSE) { # Start by retrieving the HGNC data set hgnc_tbl <- import_hgnc_dataset()  # Search for entries containing "TP53" in the HGNC data set hgnc_tbl %>%   filter_by_keyword('TP53') %>%   dplyr::select(1:4)  # The same as above but restrict the search to the `symbol` column hgnc_tbl %>%   filter_by_keyword('TP53', cols = 'symbol') %>%   dplyr::select(1:4)  # Match "TP53" exactly in the `symbol` column hgnc_tbl %>%   filter_by_keyword('^TP53$', cols = 'symbol') %>%   dplyr::select(1:4)  # `filter_by_keyword()` is vectorised over `keyword` hgnc_tbl %>%   filter_by_keyword(c('^TP53$', '^PIK3CA$'), cols = 'symbol') %>%   dplyr::select(1:4) }

what: Convert one HGNC identifier to another — hgnc_convert
title: Convert one HGNC identifier to another — hgnc_convert
text: Convert one HGNC identifier another

title: Convert one HGNC identifier to another — hgnc_convert
code: hgnc_convert(   x,   from = "hgnc_id",   to = "symbol",   one_to_many = FALSE,   file = get_hgnc_file() )

title: Convert one HGNC identifier to another — hgnc_convert
text: x vector values convert HGNC identifier convert , must column name HGNC dataset HGNC identifier convert , must column name HGNC dataset one_to_many boolean value indicating whether cases '' identifier maps multiple '' values returned. set FASLE (default), one--many cases yield NA. set TRUE, returned value list vectors varying length. file file URL complete HGNC data set (TSV format), used import_hgnc_dataset().

title: Convert one HGNC identifier to another — hgnc_convert
text: list vector converted values

title: Convert one HGNC identifier to another — hgnc_convert
code: if (FALSE) { # convert a set of hgnc_ids to symbols hgnc_ids <- c("HGNC:44948", "HGNC:43240", "HGNC:23357", "HGNC:1855", "HGNC:39400") hgnc_convert(hgnc_ids, from = 'hgnc_id', to = 'symbol') # convert a set of entrez_ids to ensembl_gene_ids entrez_ids <- c(79933, 109623458, 158471, 54987, 81631) hgnc_convert(entrez_ids, from = 'entrez_id', to = 'ensembl_gene_id') }

what: Add a column to a data frame from the hgnc dataset — hgnc_join
title: Add a column to a data frame from the hgnc dataset — hgnc_join
text: Add column data frame hgnc dataset

title: Add a column to a data frame from the hgnc dataset — hgnc_join
code: hgnc_join(   .data,   by = "hgnc_id",   column = "symbol",   one_to_many = FALSE,   file = get_hgnc_file() )

title: Add a column to a data frame from the hgnc dataset — hgnc_join
text: .data data frame join column join , dplyr::left_join() column column add data frame HGNC dataset one_to_many boolean value indicating whether cases '' column maps multiple valuesof selected column returned. set FASLE (default), one--many cases yield NA. set TRUE, returned column list vectors varying length. file file URL complete HGNC data set (TSV format), used import_hgnc_dataset().

title: Add a column to a data frame from the hgnc dataset — hgnc_join
text: data frame HGNC column added

title: Add a column to a data frame from the hgnc dataset — hgnc_join
code: if (FALSE) { library(dplyr) df <- tibble(hgnc_id = c("HGNC:44948", "HGNC:43240", "HGNC:23357", "HGNC:1855", "HGNC:39400"))  df %>%  hgnc_join(by = 'hgnc_id', column = 'symbol') %>%  hgnc_join(by = 'hgnc_id', column = 'entrez_id') }

title: Import HGNC data — import_hgnc_dataset
text: function imports memory, tibble, complete HGNC data set TSV file.

title: Import HGNC data — import_hgnc_dataset
Import HGNC data — import_hgnc_dataset
text: file file URL complete HGNC data set (TSV format). ... Additional arguments passed readr::read_tsv().

title: Import HGNC data — import_hgnc_dataset
text: tibble HGNC data set consisting 55 columns: hgnc_id unique ID provided HGNC gene approved symbol. IDs format HGNC:n, n unique number. HGNC IDs remain stable even name symbol changes. hgnc_id2 stripped version hgnc_id prefix "HGNC:" removed (column added package {hgnc}). symbol official gene symbol approved HGNC, typically short form gene name. Symbols approved accordance Guidelines Human Gene Nomenclature. name full gene name approved HGNC; corresponds approved symbol . locus_group group name set related locus types defined HGNC. One : "protein-coding gene", "non-coding RNA", "pseudogene" "". locus_type Specifies genetic class gene entry: "gene protein product" Protein-coding genes (protein may predicted unknown function), :0001217. "RNA, cluster" Region containing cluster small non-coding RNA genes. "RNA, long non-coding" Non-protein coding genes encode long non-coding RNAs (lncRNAs) :0001877; least 200 nt length. Subtypes include intergenic :0001463, intronic :0001903 antisense :0001904. "RNA, micro" Non-protein coding genes encode microRNAs (miRNAs), :0001265. "RNA, ribosomal" Non-protein coding genes encode ribosomal RNAs (rRNAs), :0001637. "RNA, small nuclear" Non-protein coding genes encode small nuclear RNAs (snRNAs), :0001268. "RNA, small nucleolar" Non-protein coding genes encode small nucleolar RNAs (snoRNAs) containing C/D H/ACA box domains, :0001267. "RNA, small cytoplasmic" Non-protein coding genes encode small cytoplasmic RNAs (scRNAs), :0001266. "RNA, transfer" Non-protein coding genes encode transfer RNAs (tRNAs), :0001272. "RNA, small misc" Non-protein coding genes encode miscellaneous types small ncRNAs, vault (:0000404) Y (:0000405) RNA genes. "phenotype " Mapped phenotypes causative gene identified, :0001500. "pseudogene" Genomic DNA sequences similar protein-coding genes encode functional protein, :0000336. "complex locus constituent" Transcriptional unit part named complex locus. "endogenous retrovirus" Integrated retroviral elements transmitted germline, :0000100. "fragile site" heritable locus chromosome prone DNA breakage. "immunoglobulin gene" Gene segments undergo somatic recombination form heavy light chain immunoglobulin genes (:0000460). Also includes immunoglobulin gene segments open reading frames either undergo somatic recombination, encode peptide predicted fold correctly; identified inclusion term "non-functional" gene name. "immunoglobulin pseudogene" Immunoglobulin gene segments inactivated due frameshift mutations /stop codons open reading frame. "protocadherin" Gene segments constitute three clustered protocadherins (alpha, beta gamma) "readthrough" naturally occurring transcript containing coding sequence two genes can also transcribed individually. "region" Extents genomic sequence contain one genes, also applied non-gene areas fall types. "T cell receptor gene" Gene segments undergo somatic recombination form either alpha, beta, gamma delta chain T cell receptor genes (:0000460). Also includes T cell receptor gene segments open reading frames either undergo somatic recombination, encode peptide predicted fold correctly; identified inclusion term "non-functional" gene name. "T cell receptor pseudogene" T cell receptor gene segments inactivated due frameshift mutations /stop codons open reading frame. "transposable element" segment repetitive DNA can move, retrotranspose, new sites within genome (:0000101). "unknown" Entries locus type currently unknown. "virus integration site" Target sequence integration viral DNA genome. status Status symbol report, can either "Approved" "Entry Withdrawn". location Chromosomal location. Indicates cytogenetic location gene region chromsome, e.g. "19q13.43". absence information one following may listed: "reference assembly" Named gene annotated current version Genome Reference Consortium human reference assembly; may annotated previous assembly versions non-reference human assembly. "unplaced" Named gene annotated unplaced/unlocalized scaffold human reference assembly. "reserved" Named gene never annotated human assembly. location_sortable sortable version location column (see ). alias_symbol Alternative symbols used refer gene. Aliases may literature, databases may added represent membership gene group. alias_name Alternative names gene. Aliases may literature, databases may added represent membership gene group. prev_symbol field displays symbols previously HGNC-approved nomenclature. prev_name field displays names previously HGNC-approved nomenclature. gene_group gene group. gene assigned one groups, according either sequence similarity information publications, specialist advisors group databases. Groups may either structural functional. gene_group_id Gene group identifier, integer number. column contains gene group identifiers, see gene_group gene group name. date_approved_reserved date entry first approved. date_symbol_changed date gene symbol last changed. date_name_changed date gene name last changed. date_modified Date entry last modified. entrez_id Entrez gene identifier. ensembl_gene_id Ensembl gene identifier. vega_id VEGA gene identifier. ucsc_id UCSC gene identifier. ena International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (GenBank, ENA DDBJ) accession number(s). refseq_accession Reference Sequence (RefSeq) identifier entry, provided NCBI. ccds_id Consensus CDS identifier. uniprot_ids UniProt protein accession. pubmed_id Pubmed Europe Pubmed Central PMIDs. mgd_id Mouse genome informatics database identifier. rgd_id Rat genome database gene identifier. lsdb name Locus Specific Mutation Database URL gene. cosmic Symbol used within Catalogue somatic mutations cancer gene. omim_id Online Mendelian Inheritance Man (OMIM) identifier. mirbase miRBase identifier. homeodb Homeobox Database identifier. snornabase snoRNABase identifier. bioparadigms_slc Symbol used link SLC tables database bioparadigms.org gene. orphanet Orphanet identifier. pseudogene.org Pseudogene.org identifier. horde_id Symbol used within HORDE gene. merops Identifier used link MEROPS peptidase database. imgt Symbol used within international ImMunoGeneTics information system. iuphar objectId used link IUPHAR/BPS Guide PHARMACOLOGY database. kznf_gene_catalog Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory Human KZNF Gene Catalog (LLNL) identifier. mamit-trnadb Identifier link Mamit-tRNA database. cd Symbol used within Human Cell Differentiation Molecule database gene. lncrnadb lncRNA Database identifier. enzyme_id ENZYME EC accession number. intermediate_filament_db Identifier used link Human Intermediate Filament Database. rna_central_ids Identifier RNAcentral, non-coding RNA sequence database. lncipedia LNCipedia identifier gene belongs. appear gene long non-coding RNA. gtrnadb GtRNAdb identifier gene belongs. appear gene tRNA. agr Alliance Genomic Resources HGNC ID Human gene page within resource. mane_select MANE Select nucleotide accession version (.e. NCBI RefSeq Ensembl transcript ID version). gencc Gene Curation Coalition (GenCC) Database identifier.

what:
Set the HGNC TSV file to use for import_hgnc_dataset().
Defaults to the latest_archive_url(), but can also use latest_monthly_url() or latest_quarterly_url()` — use_hgnc_file
title:

Defaults to the latest_archive_url(), but can also use latest_monthly_url() or latest_quarterly_url()` — use_hgnc_file

title:
Set the HGNC TSV file to use for import_hgnc_dataset().
Defaults to the latest_archive_url(), but can also use latest_monthly_url() or latest_quarterly_url()` — use_hgnc_file
code: # use the default file given by import_hgnc_dataset() use_hgnc_file() #> using hgnc file: https://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/genenames/hgnc/tsv/hgnc_complete_set.txt  # use to the latest monthly release use_hgnc_file(file = latest_monthly_url()) #> using hgnc file: https://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/genenames/hgnc/archive/monthly/tsv/hgnc_complete_set_2023-10-01.txt  # use a predefined release for reproducibility use_hgnc_file(file = "https://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/genenames/hgnc/archive/monthly/tsv/hgnc_complete_set_2023-08-01.txt") #> using hgnc file: https://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/genenames/hgnc/archive/monthly/tsv/hgnc_complete_set_2023-08-01.txt

title: hgnc 0.1.4
text: CRAN release: 2023-08-29 Fix https://github.com/ramiromagno/hgnc/issues/2.

title: hgnc 0.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2023-06-29 Transition documentation maialab.org rmagno.eu. Updated ftp_ls() reflect server side changes.

title: hgnc 0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2022-06-08 Fixed code examples relied Internet resources — examples longer fail resources available. Eliminated dependency memoise altogether https://github.com/r-lib/memoise/issues/76.

title: hgnc 0.1.1
text: filter_by_keyword() now vectorised keyword. import_hgnc_dataset() now memoised.

title: hgnc 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-03-21 First version hgnc.
